text:
US President Trump will decide within the next two weeks whether the US will join the Israel-Iran conflict due to a “chance of negotiation,”, according to the White House.

 Follow our LIVE coverage: https://aje.io/yt6ojg

“Our offensive missile power is growing.”

The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) says it has fired its 17th wave of missiles at Israeli military facilities, including the Nevatim and Hatzerim bases.

 LIVE updates: http://aje.io/aetafq

US President Trump could significantly expand his travel ban list in the next few weeks to include 36 more countries, 26 of which are in Africa, say US media reports.

Here’s what we know about the possible Africa travel bans and who could be affected http://aje.io/y7b6xl

Israel has launched strikes on dozens of targets in Iran and Iran fired a barrage of missiles that hit near industrial facilities in Israel's Beersheba, as the conflict between the two sides entered its second week
Iranian missiles struck Beersheba in southern Israel for the second consecutive day, causing extensive damage to a residential block and hitting a technology park housing software giant Microsoft.
At least 35 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire while waiting for humanitarian aid near Gaza's Netzarim Corridor, sources at al-Awda Hospital told Al Jazeera http://aje.io/4vcgq2

Pro-Palestinian activists have broken into a Royal Air Force base in central England and claimed to have damaged two military aircraft to protest against the UK government’s support for Israel’s war on Gaza http://aje.io/0udeyp

'The EU’s strategic interests may no longer be best served by its alliance with the US - especially under President Donald Trump’s increasingly dangerous agenda'

— #AJOpinion by Santiago Zabala & Claudio Gallo
UCL winners Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) suffer shock 1-0 FIFA Club World Cup defeat to Brazil's Botafogo http://aje.io/4n0crt

Israel included for the second year in a row on UN report into child violations, which says Israeli forces fulfilled criteria of a “party that kills and maims children” and “a party that engages in attacks on schools and/or hospitals.”

 Read report: http://aje.io/gsaw37
Iran to hold talks with the UK, France and Germany in Switzerland on Friday in an attempt to prevent an escalation in its conflict with Israel http://aje.io/si8rfg

Australia, Slovakia and the Czech Republic are suspending operations at their embassies in Iran's capital Tehran due to the deteriorating security environment, say the foreign ministries of each country.

 LIVE updates: http://aje.io/3c70g0
Putin, Xi criticise Israel’s attacks on Iran, urge de-escalation

IAEA chief Rafael Grossi says although Iran lacked transparency, his inspectors found no evidence of an active nuclear weapons programme. So why did Israel strike within 24 hours?

Watch the full interview here  https://aje.io/Grossi
Two jailed for 30 years over 2019 Kenya hotel attack
Russia and Indonesia are strengthening ties following a meeting between Presidents Putin and Prabowo in St Petersburg https://aje.io/ww67xj

As the conflict between Israel and Iran intensifies, President Trump is moving military assets to strategic areas in the region. Al Jazeera’s Project Force looks at what the US has in its toolbox — and how it could be used.
The War Powers Act gives Congress a role in authorising military action, but it may not be enough to prevent US President Trump from attacking Iran https://aje.io/rmqmmo
Iran has no clear way to end its war with Israel, and analysts warn it could soon draw in the US and spark a new crisis in the Middle East https://aje.io/5an9ef

Over 5,100 Palestinian children were treated for malnutrition in Gaza in May, UNICEF says, warning of an “alarming” rise as Israel continues to block most aid from entering the war-torn territory.

 LIVE updates: http://aje.io/ez2sq6
A group of Israeli soldiers held a birthday party in a Palestinian home in the town of Jaba, in the occupied West Bank, after raiding and forcibly evicting the residents.

At least 92 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli attacks across Gaza so far on Thursday, including 16 who were struck while seeking aid near the Netzarim Corridor in the north, according to Palestinian health officials.

 LIVE updates: http://aje.io/ez2sq6

Uri Dromi, founding director general of the Jerusalem Press Club, says Israel has no intention of ending the Iran conflict until they reach the specific goal of causing 'serious damage to the Iranian nuclear operation.'
Real Madrid star and France international Kylian Mbappe hospitalised at FIFA Club World Cup in the US http://aje.io/4j1kzd

"Stop the war and choose dialogue over destruction."

Iranian human rights activists and Nobel Peace Prize laureates Narges Mohammadi and Shirin Ebadi have urged that the war between Israel and Iran end.

 LIVE updates: http://aje.io/mcr07t
Eyewitness video shows one of Elon Musk’s SpaceX Starships, Starship 36, erupting in a huge fireball during a ground test in the US state of Texas.

At least 81 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli attacks across the Gaza Strip as desperate Palestinians continue to seek food amid an ongoing hunger crisis.

Read more: https://aje.io/wcbsdz
Thai PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s government is in crisis after a major coalition partner quit amid mounting public anger over a leaked phone call with a former Cambodian leader https://aje.io/fje6cx
Pakistanis flee Iran as the Israel-Iran conflict deepens. Pakistan shuts border crossings, raising fears of wider instability in the nuclear-armed nation.

A quarter century before the 1979 revolution, the US and UK helped depose democratically elected Iranian PM Mossadegh. Now, Israel is seeking a redux with US help.

: https://aje.io/893ejy
Iran has launched another missile attack against Israel, causing extensive damage across the country and striking Israel’s primary hospital in the south.

“For years I have stayed quiet about the violence me and others have faced…”

Is Iran ‘very close’ to building a nuclear bomb as Trump claims?
Iran warns US intervention in conflict with Israel risks ‘all out war’
Israel-Iran conflict rages with ongoing aerial strikes amid war of words
Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,211

US President Trump demands Iran’s “unconditional surrender,” saying, “We now have complete and total control of the skies over Iran,” as the US reportedly deploys more fighter jets to the Middle East.

Croatia’s President Milanović said a portion of Israel’s leadership is “made up of criminals” and that Israel is pursuing “a criminal policy” with the support of the US.

This LIVE thread is now closed.

Lionel Messi’s Inter Miami look for their first win against two-time Champions League winners Porto at the Club World Cup.
As Israel and Iran launch strikes against each other, a parallel propaganda war is taking place using carefully chosen symbols and language.

Iran fired a wave of retaliatory strikes on Israel with some Iranian ballistic missiles getting through Israel’s missile defence systems and hitting key targets.

We look at how Tehran's missiles are making it past Israeli air defences http://aje.io/uyagnu
Israel has nuclear bombs and a policy of nuclear ambiguity while Iran, without a bomb, is the one treated as a threat, says Marc Owen Jones, at Northwestern University in Qatar.

Most Britons who oppose Israel’s war on Gaza believe the onslaught, which has to date killed more than 55,000 Palestinians, amounts to genocide, according to a new survey.

Read more: http://aje.io/r9vpt1

In an exclusive interview with Al Jazeera, Iran's foreign ministry spokesman said his country was in a fight with a genocidal enemy, and any US intervention in the conflict with Israel "would be a recipe for an all-out war."

In an address to the nation, Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei rejected President Trump’s call for surrender in the conflict with Israel, and warned any US strikes on Iran will have “irreparable consequences.”
Dozens of flights to and from Bali cancelled after Indonesia's Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki volcano erupted on Tuesday http://aje.io/ps9xz7

Germany will continue to organise special commercial flights out of Jordan for its citizens who are looking to leave Israel as long as there is a need and the situation permits, says a Foreign Office spokesperson in Berlin.

 LIVE updates: http://aje.io/fllg92
Ali Vaez, senior advisor at the International Crisis Group, says President Trump could halt Israel's attacks on Iran, but he’s more likely to join the fight than stop it.

Russian President Vladimir Putin has spoken by phone with Emirati President Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan about the Israel-Iran crisis and Russia’s willingness to help mediate the crisis.

 LIVE updates: http://aje.io/ze0auw
